intro: Pentanema salicinum subsp. sabuletorum, commonly known as the sabulose pentanema, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The subspecies is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal or inland dune environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically pollinated by insects. This plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
